author: tersec
content:
<@892053833121923094> my initial step towards enabling the (0, 0) ALTAIR/BELLATRIX fork epoch configuration you described a few days ago is https://github.com/status-im/nimbus-eth2/pull/3649 (not yet merged), but after investigating some anomalies with it, created https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/issues/2902 as well.

It looks like especially in the context of something like Hive, the point of which is to be exacting and pedantic about the protocols, `ALTAIR_FORK_EPOCH == BELLATRIX_FORK_EPOCH` probably is too fragile in general, so maybe worth focusing more after all on the `ALTAIR_FORK_EPOCH == BELLATRIX_FORK_EPOCH == 0` case specifically.

author: marioevz
content:
Yes this is the normal configuration in hive for EL clients too: set all fork block numbers 0 to speed up the tests.

I think if we can focus on that specific case on the CLs too, it would be valuable even if only for testing purposes...

author: tersec
content: Testingwise, for Nimbus we deliberately have it run through all the forks (it runs a local testnet as part of CI) to help ensure that older forks, as well as fork transitions themselves, don't regress, but I do agree that minimizing wasted time here is valuable.
